Description: Very small scarab made of a light purple quartz, the outline is roughly cut in shape. The back is divided by a single line into prothorax and elytra with the suture cut in a single line. The head is shaped in a triangle with the base towards the outside, the clypeus is indicated by two notches. The beetle is divided from the base by a surrounding line, the hind legs are stylized by one line as well. The base is empty.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
